MOVEMENT, POSITION, AND DISTANCE

Miniatures are on the 30mm scale—a miniature figure of a six-foot-tall human is approximately 30mm tall. A square on the battle grid is 1 inch across, representing a 5-foot-by-5-foot area.

Hampered 이동: Difficult terrain, obstacles, or poor visibility can hamper 이동.

If you do nothing but 이동 (that is, if you use both of your actions in a round to 이동 your 속도), you can 이동 double your 속도.

If you spend the entire round running, you can 이동 quadruple your 속도. If you do something that requires a full round you can only take a 5-foot step.

거리 측정
Measuring Distance

Diagonals: When 거리 측정, the first diagonal counts as 1 square, the second counts as 2 squares, the third counts as 1, the fourth as 2, and so on.

You can’t 이동 diagonally past a corner (even by taking a 5-foot step). You can 이동 diagonally past a creature, even an opponent.

You can also 이동 diagonally past other impassable obstacles, such as pits.

Closest Creature: When it’s important to determine the closest square or creature to a location, if two squares or creatures are equally close, randomly determine which one counts as closest by rolling a die.

한 정사각형 이동
Moving through a Square

Friend: You can 이동 through a square occupied by a friendly character, unless you are charging. When you 이동 through a square occupied by a friendly character, that character doesn’t provide you with 엄폐.

Opponent: You can’t 이동 through a square occupied by an opponent, unless the opponent is helpless. You can 이동 through a square occupied by a helpless opponent without penalty. (Some creatures, particularly very large ones, may present an obstacle even when helpless. In such cases, each square you 이동 through counts as 2 squares.)

Ending Your 이동: You can’t end your 이동 in the same square as another creature unless it is helpless.

Tumbling: A trained character can attempt to 재주넘기 through a square occupied by an opponent (see the 재주넘기 skill).

Square Occupied by Creature Three Sizes Larger or Smaller: Any creature can 이동 through a square occupied by a creature three size categories larger than it is.

A big creature can 이동 through a square occupied by a creature three size categories smaller than it is.

Designated Exceptions: Some creatures break the above rules. A creature that completely fills the squares it occupies cannot be moved past, even with the 재주넘기 skill or similar 특수 능력.

지형과 장애물
Terrain and Obstacles

Difficult Terrain: Difficult terrain hampers 이동. Each square of difficult terrain counts as 2 squares of 이동. (Each diagonal 이동 into a difficult terrain square counts as 3 squares.) You can’t 달리기 or 돌격 across difficult terrain.

If you occupy squares with different kinds of terrain, you can 이동 only as fast as the most difficult terrain you occupy will allow.

Flying and incorporeal creatures are not hampered by difficult terrain.

Obstacles: Like difficult terrain, obstacles can hamper 이동. If an obstacle hampers 이동 but doesn’t completely block it each obstructed square or obstacle between squares counts as 2 squares of 이동. You must pay this cost to cross the barrier, in addition to the cost to 이동 into the square on the other side. If you don’t have sufficient 이동 to cross the barrier and 이동 into the square on the other side, you can’t cross the barrier. Some obstacles may also require a skill check to cross.

On the other hand, some obstacles block 이동 entirely. A character can’t 이동 through a blocking obstacle.

Flying and incorporeal creatures can avoid most obstacles

Squeezing: In some cases, you may have to squeeze into or through an area that isn’t as wide as the space you take up. You can squeeze through or into a space that is at least half as wide as your normal space. Each 이동 into or through a narrow space counts as if it were 2 squares, and while squeezed in a narrow space you take a –4 penalty on 명중 굴림 and a –4 penalty to AC.

When a Large creature (which normally takes up four squares) squeezes into a space that’s one square wide, the creature’s miniature figure occupies two squares, centered on the line between the two squares. For a bigger creature, center the creature likewise in the area it squeezes into.

A creature can squeeze past an opponent while moving but it can’t end its 이동 in an occupied square.

To squeeze through or into a space less than half your space’s width, you must use the 탈출 전문가 skill. You can’t 공격 while using 탈출 전문가 to squeeze through or into a narrow space, you take a –4 penalty to AC, and you lose any 민첩 bonus to AC.

특수 이동 규칙
Special Movement Rules

These rules 엄폐 special 이동 situations.

Accidentally Ending 이동 in an Illegal Space: Sometimes a character ends its 이동 while moving through a space where it’s not allowed to stop. When that happens, put your miniature in the last legal position you occupied, or the closest legal position, if there’s a legal position that’s closer.

Double 이동 Cost: When your 이동 is hampered in some way, your 이동 usually costs double. For example, each square of 이동 through difficult terrain counts as 2 squares, and each diagonal 이동 through such terrain counts as 3 squares (just as two diagonal 이동 normally do).

If 이동 cost is doubled twice, then each square counts as 4 squares (or as 6 squares if moving diagonally). If 이동 cost is doubled three times, then each square counts as 8 squares (12 if diagonal) and so on. This is an exception to the general rule that two doublings are equivalent to a tripling.

Minimum 이동: Despite penalties to 이동, you can take a full-round action to 이동 5 feet (1 square) in any direction, even diagonally. (This rule doesn’t allow you to 이동 through impassable terrain or to 이동 when all 이동 is prohibited.) Such 이동 provokes 기회 공격 as normal (despite the distance covered, this 이동 isn’t a 5-foot step).

크거나 작은 생명체의 전투

BIG AND LITTLE CREATURES IN COMBAT

Creatures smaller than Small or larger than Medium have special rules relating to position.

Tiny, Diminutive, and Fine Creatures: Very small creatures take up less than 1 square of space. This means that more than one such creature can fit into a single square. A Tiny creature typically occupies a space only 2-1/2 feet across, so four can fit into a single square. Twenty-five Diminutive creatures or 100 Fine creatures can fit into a single square. Creatures that take up less than 1 square of space typically have a natural reach of 0 feet, meaning they can’t reach into adjacent squares. They must enter an opponent’s square to 공격 in melee. This provokes an 공격 of opportunity from the opponent. You can 공격 into your own square if you need to, so you can 공격 such creatures normally. Since they have no natural reach, they do not threaten the squares around them. You can 이동 past them without provoking 기회 공격. They also can’t flank an enemy.

Large, Huge, Gargantuan, and Colossal Creatures: Very large creatures take up more than 1 square.

Creatures that take up more than 1 square typically have a natural reach of 10 feet or more, meaning that they can reach targets even if they aren’t in adjacent squares.

Unlike when someone uses a reach weapon, a creature with 상급 than normal natural reach (more than 5 feet) still threatens squares adjacent to it. A creature with 상급 than normal natural reach usually gets an 공격 of opportunity against you if you approach it, because you must enter and 이동 within the 범위 of its reach before you can 공격 it. (This 공격 of opportunity is not provoked if you take a 5-foot step.)

Large or larger creatures using reach 무기 can strike up to double their natural reach but can’t strike at their natural reach or less.

엄폐

COVER

To determine whether your target has 엄폐 from your ranged 공격, choose a corner of your square. If any line from this corner to any corner of the target’s square passes through a square or border that blocks line of effect or provides 엄폐, or through a square occupied by a creature, the target has 엄폐 (+4 to AC).

When making a melee 공격 against an adjacent target, your target has 엄폐 if any line from your square to the target’s square goes through a wall (including a low wall). When making a melee 공격 against a target that isn’t adjacent to you (such as with a reach weapon), use the rules for determining 엄폐 from ranged 공격.

Low Obstacles and 엄폐: A low obstacle (such as a wall no higher than half your height) provides 엄폐, but only to creatures within 30 feet (6 squares) of it. The attacker can ignore the 엄폐 if he’s closer to the obstacle than his target.

엄폐 and 기회 공격: You can’t execute an 공격 of opportunity against an opponent with 엄폐 relative to you.

엄폐 and Reflex 내성 굴림: 엄폐 grants you a +2 bonus on Reflex 내성 굴림 against 공격 that originate or 폭발 out from a point on the other side of the 엄폐 from you. Note that spread effects can extend around corners and thus negate this 엄폐 bonus.

엄폐 and 숨기 Checks: You can use 엄폐 to make a 숨기 check. Without 엄폐, you usually need 은폐 (see below) to make a 숨기 check.

Soft 엄폐: Creatures, even your enemies, can provide you with 엄폐 against ranged 공격, giving you a +4 bonus to AC. However, such soft 엄폐 provides no bonus on Reflex 내성 굴림, nor does soft 엄폐 allow you to make a 숨기 check.

Big Creatures and 엄폐: Any creature with a space larger than 5 feet (1 square) determines 엄폐 against melee 공격 slightly differently than smaller creatures do. Such a creature can choose any square that it occupies to determine if an opponent has 엄폐 against its melee 공격. Similarly, when making a melee 공격 against such a creature, you can pick any of the squares it occupies to determine if it has 엄폐 against you.

Total 엄폐: If you don’t have line of effect to your target he is considered to have total 엄폐 from you. You can’t make an 공격 against a target that has total 엄폐.

Varying Degrees of 엄폐: In some cases, 엄폐 may provide a 상급 bonus to AC and Reflex 내성 굴림. In such situations the normal 엄폐 bonuses to AC and Reflex 내성 굴림 can be doubled (to +8 and +4, respectively). A creature with this improved 엄폐 effectively gains improved evasion against any 공격 to which the Reflex save bonus applies. Furthermore, improved 엄폐 provides a +10 bonus on 숨기 checks.

은폐

CONCEALMENT

To determine whether your target has 은폐 from your ranged 공격, choose a corner of your square. If any line from this corner to any corner of the target’s square passes through a square or border that provides 은폐, the target has 은폐.

When making a melee 공격 against an adjacent target, your target has 은폐 if his space is entirely within an effect that grants 은폐. When making a melee 공격 against a target that isn’t adjacent to you use the rules for determining 은폐 from ranged 공격.

In addition, some magical effects provide 은폐 against all 공격, regardless of whether any intervening 은폐 exists.

은폐 Miss Chance: 은폐 gives the subject of a successful 공격 a 20% chance that the attacker missed because of the 은폐. If the attacker hits, the defender must make a miss chance percentile roll to avoid being struck. Multiple 은폐 상태이상 do not stack.

Total 은폐: If you have line of effect to a target but not line of sight he is considered to have total 은폐 from you. You can’t 공격 an opponent that has total 은폐, though you can 공격 into a square that you think he occupies. A successful 공격 into a square occupied by an enemy with total 은폐 has a 50% miss chance (instead of the normal 20% miss chance for an opponent with 은폐).

You can’t execute an 공격 of opportunity against an opponent with total 은폐, even if you know what square or squares the opponent occupies.

Ignoring 은폐: 은폐 isn’t always effective. A shadowy area or 암흑 doesn’t provide any 은폐 against an opponent with 암흑시야. Characters with 저광시야 can see clearly for a 상급 distance with the same 빛 source than other characters. Although 투명화 provides total 은폐, sighted opponents may still make 감지 checks to notice the location of an invisible character. An invisible character gains a +20 bonus on 숨기 checks if moving, or a +40 bonus on 숨기 checks when not moving (even though opponents can’t see you, they might be able to figure out where you are from other visual clues).

Varying Degrees of 은폐: Certain situations may provide more or less than typical 은폐, and modify the miss chance accordingly.

협공

FLANKING

When making a melee 공격, you get a +2 협공 bonus if your opponent is threatened by a character or creature friendly to you on the opponent’s opposite border or opposite corner.

When in doubt about whether two friendly characters flank an opponent in the middle, trace an imaginary line between the two friendly characters’ centers. If the line passes through opposite borders of the opponent’s space (including corners of those borders), then the opponent is flanked.

Exception: If a flanker takes up more than 1 square, it gets the 협공 bonus if any square it occupies counts for 협공.

Only a creature or character that threatens the defender can help an attacker get a 협공 bonus.

Creatures with a reach of 0 feet can’t flank an opponent.

무력화 상태의 상대방

HELPLESS DEFENDERS

A helpless opponent is someone who is bound, sleeping, paralyzed, unconscious, or otherwise at your mercy.

Regular 공격: A helpless character takes a –4 penalty to AC against melee 공격, but no penalty to AC against ranged 공격.

A helpless defender can’t use any 민첩 bonus to AC. In fact, his 민첩 score is treated as if it were 0 and his 민첩 modifier to AC as if it were –5 (and a 도적 can sneak 공격 him).

Coup de Grace: As a full-round action, you can use a melee weapon to deliver a coup de grace to a helpless opponent. You can also use a bow or crossbow, provided you are adjacent to the target.

You automatically hit and score a critical hit. If the defender survives the 피해, he must make a Fortitude save (DC 10 + 피해 dealt) or die. A 도적 also gets her extra sneak 공격 피해 against a helpless opponent when delivering a coup de grace.

Delivering a coup de grace provokes 기회 공격 from threatening opponents.

You can’t deliver a coup de grace against a creature that is immune to critical hits. You can deliver a coup de grace against a creature with total 은폐, but doing this requires two consecutive 전체 라운드 행동 (one to “find” the creature once you’ve determined what square it’s in, and one to deliver the coup de grace).

AID ANOTHER

In melee 전투, you can help a friend 공격 or defend by distracting or interfering with an opponent. Multiple characters can 보조 the same friend, and similar bonuses stack.

You can also use this standard action to help a friend in other ways, such as when he is affected by a spell, or to assist another character’s skill check.

황소 쇄도

You can make a 황소 쇄도 as a standard action (an 공격) or as part of a 돌격 (see 돌격, below). When you make a 황소 쇄도, you attempt to push an opponent straight back instead of damaging him. You can only 황소 쇄도 an opponent who is one size category larger than you, the same size, or smaller.

Initiating a 황소 쇄도: First, you 이동 into the defender’s space. Doing this provokes an 공격 of opportunity from each opponent that threatens you, including the defender. (If you have the 향상된 황소 쇄도 feat, you don’t provoke an 공격 of opportunity from the defender.) Any 공격 of opportunity made by anyone other than the defender against you during a 황소 쇄도 has a 25% chance of accidentally targeting the defender instead, and any 공격 of opportunity by anyone other than you against the defender likewise has a 25% chance of accidentally targeting you. (When someone makes an 공격 of opportunity, make the 명중 굴림 and then roll to see whether the 공격 went astray.)

Second, you and the defender make opposed 근력 checks. You each add a +4 bonus for each size category you are larger than Medium or a –4 penalty for each size category you are smaller than Medium. You get a +2 bonus if you are charging. The defender gets a +4 bonus if he has more than two legs or is otherwise exceptionally stable.

황소 쇄도 Results: If you beat the defender’s 근력 check result, you push him back 5 feet. If you 소원 to 이동 with the defender, you can push him back an additional 5 feet for each 5 points by which your check result is 상급 than the defender’s check result. You can’t, however, exceed your normal 이동 limit. (Note: The defender provokes 기회 공격 if he is moved. So do you, if you 이동 with him. The two of you do not provoke 기회 공격 from each other, however.)

If you fail to beat the defender’s 근력 check result, you 이동 5 feet straight back to where you were before you moved into his space. If that space is occupied, you fall prone in that space.

돌격

Charging is a special full-round action that allows you to 이동 up to twice your 속도 and 공격 during the action. However, it carries tight restrictions on how you can 이동.

이동 During a 돌격: You must 이동 before your 공격, not after. You must 이동 at least 10 feet (2 squares) and may 이동 up to double your 속도 directly toward the designated opponent.

You must have a clear path toward the opponent, and nothing can hinder your 이동 (such as difficult terrain or obstacles). Here’s what it means to have a clear path. First, you must 이동 to the closest space from which you can 공격 the opponent. (If this space is occupied or otherwise blocked, you can’t 돌격.) Second, if any line from your starting space to the ending space passes through a square that blocks 이동, 감속화 이동, or contains a creature (even an ally), you can’t 돌격. (Helpless creatures don’t stop a 돌격.)

If you don’t have line of sight to the opponent at the start of your turn, you can’t 돌격 that opponent.

You can’t take a 5-foot step in the same round as a 돌격.

If you are able to take only a standard action or a 이동 action on your turn, you can still 돌격, but you are only allowed to 이동 up to your 속도 (instead of up to double your 속도). You can’t use this option unless you are restricted to taking only a standard action or 이동 action on your turn.

Attacking on a 돌격: After moving, you may make a single melee 공격. You get a +2 bonus on the 명중 굴림. and take a –2 penalty to your AC until the start of your next turn.

A charging character gets a +2 bonus on the 근력 check made to 황소 쇄도 an opponent (see 황소 쇄도, above).

Even if you have extra 공격, such as from having a high enough base 공격 보너스 or from using multiple 무기, you only get to make one 공격 during a 돌격.

Lances and 돌격 공격: A lance deals double 피해 if employed by a mounted character in a 돌격.

무기 Readied against a 돌격: Spears, tridents, and certain other piercing 무기 deal double 피해 when readied (set) and used against a charging character.

무장해제

DISARM

As a melee 공격, you may attempt to 무장해제 your opponent. If you do so with a weapon, you 똑똑똑 the opponent’s weapon out of his hands and to the ground. If you attempt the 무장해제 while unarmed, you end up with the weapon in your hand.

If you’re attempting to 무장해제 a melee weapon, follow the steps outlined here. If the item you are attempting to 무장해제 isn’t a melee weapon the defender may still oppose you with an 명중 굴림, but takes a penalty and can’t attempt to 무장해제 you in return if your attempt fails.

Step 1: 공격 of Opportunity. You provoke an 공격 of opportunity from the target you are trying to 무장해제. (If you have the 향상된 무장해제 feat, you don’t incur an 공격 of opportunity for making a 무장해제 attempt.) If the defender’s 공격 of opportunity deals any 피해, your 무장해제 attempt fails.

Step 2: Opposed Rolls. You and the defender make opposed 명중 굴림 with your respective 무기. The wielder of a two-handed weapon on a 무장해제 attempt gets a +4 bonus on this roll, and the wielder of a 빛 weapon takes a –4 penalty. (An unarmed strike is considered a 빛 weapon, so you always take a penalty when trying to 무장해제 an opponent by using an unarmed strike.)
